title: Holy hell Volibear is terrifying.
body:
Spoilers of course.

But holy shit volibear is terrifying in that new story.

> ### *Volibear is now an almost lovecraft-esque bear god who changes and contorts the forms of those who worship him. [](https://.) He's perpetually covered in blood and gore. [](https://.) His consciousness is so all powerful he can basically shut out anyone elses mind like a giant mental blob that just absorbs your mind into this giant collective of the bear god.*

This rework is gonna be mortifying. In a good way.

5 YEARS. Goddamn how tight is the lore bathplug at Riot.

So was Udyr already intended at the time of writing as someone who can channel way more than four animal spirits? It seems to me to be a soft retcon that allows you to change his abilities to reflect freljordian gods for a potential vgu, which i recall was a pretty recent discussion.

Yeah, I didn't really care about the number of things he could channel.  I wanted to highlight that what we do in the lore, shouldn't be boxed in by the fact that the game is based on QWER.  
I thought he should channel creatures from where he was from.   (There is a lack of tundra turtles as far as I know) And I thought that the creatures he channels should be more interesting than a basic D&D druid.  

.,...
I was in a worldbuilding room and we were looking at characters that were problematic.   And trying to figure out what they could be.  I think this was around the time the retcon was announced.  I was hired around then-- it was decided at least a year before I got there.

  I wrote a version of this story with spirit animals and Anivia, and stuff.   It was intended as a story sketch*.  And that story kinda took off.  (I added the ref to Ornn later)   Even though players never saw it, the story became foundational for the faction and shared within Riot.  Because it was beloved, there was always the desire to release it to players  (and it was almost released 8 times! previously) but it always got put back on the burner. 

(*It was actually a "story sketch" before I started calling them that, and before I joined the champion team.   And if you don't know: A story sketch is a story that is meant to illustrate a personality, champion ability, or worldbuilding concept_ internally_ within rito for teammates in art, production, and gameplay disciplines.  Ultimately you could think of a story sketch as a type written "concept art" but for personalities and worldbuilding)

I don't really like to slap a link to a wall of text but considering your story made me ask the question and this comment itself references the retcon, I thought I'd ask. Are you and the lore team ever going to write a giant article about how you chose what to keep and what to axe from the old lore? People who say "literally everything was deleted" etc. etc. don't see the effort that is put in to keep what worked from the old story, and I think a lot of us would really appreciate having a look into the process of how the writers decided to rebuild Runeterra from the cumulative little chunks of salvageable story you found in the old lore.

Here's my original post, like I said it's a wall of text so no worries if you don't want to read it, the TL;DR as stated above is I would love an article on how Riot decided what to keep in the new universe. https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/ubmI55aE-riot-are-you-ever-going-to-do-an-all-inclusive-article-on-how-you-converted-the-old-lore

Why didn't it come out til now?

Now that Mordekaiser is being updated,  Volibear has become my next most anticipated rework. Ever since Ornn's stories detailed the absolute bloodlust and destructive power of Volibear I've wanted to see him in game. Now he additionally has Lovecraftian and horror elements in there as well, I'm so excited. Hopefully he's coming sooner rather than later.
Remember when Volibear was just a hardened leader of his tribe? But nah this seems pretty neat, shame about riot constantly gutting old identities though.

I'm going to be that guy and ask why did Riot change Volibear so severely? I remember people were worried about him being a villain when Ornn came out. We were told (by players but maybe rioters?) that was one perspective. How can Volibear be portrayed as a heroic character?

The Volibear is the power of the storm, nature's rage against all who would restrain it. It is the willpower that fuels us when the winter growls with cold hunger. It is the energy that courses through all living beings, driving them ever forward. The Volibear is man and beast and the line between, and to understand him is to understand what we all are in the eye of the storm.

... Is what I'd imagine a Voli worshipper would say.

With most other champions you could probably escape from them because you're not being forced to make a choice on how to end your life.
